name: Hyatt Regency La Jolla

reviews.text: We spent whole week in this hotel and although our room was nice and clean and hotel staff was rather friendly I think we won’t choose this hotel again as we find it overpriced and really oriented to business people or big party groups.
reviews.title: Overpriced and not family friendly

reviews.text: I was staying at this facility for a conference. My husband decided to come along at the last minute and wanted to bring his boat, which is trailored behind our massive truck. I called the hotel the day before asking if parking would allow for this. The woman I spoke with said, just come, we will figure it out. Well when we arrived they had a space all set aside for our boat. We had the staff valet park our truck and felt like everything was perfectly safe. On the day that my husband went fishing, they helped him get out....when he arrived with 5, 30 pound Ahi Tuna, they helped us keep them iced until we could leave. They were great. The facility was wonderful. I can't believe how friendly and accomodating the staff was to us. They treated us like VIPs...even with crappy truck and smelly fishing boat in tow. The room was perfectly clean, beds luxiourous. The facilities for the conference were perfect. We used the pool one day, it was wonderful. Had drinks in the bar....ate at the Sushi bar across the way. Everything was perfect and we will most definetely stay here again...and bring the decent car next time...that is unless my husband feels the need to go fishing again. We were staying at a conference rate...so, the price was excellent.
reviews.title: Fabulous Staff

likes.disliked: — That we would need to leave

reviews.text: Hotel is conveniently located- right off highway. About 20 minutes to downtown with no traffic. Close to the beautiful La Jolla Cove- which is worth seeing.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel- Parking Ridiculous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are large- very clean. Amenities are as advertised- the pool is nice. Did not eat at the hotel- 4 nice restaraunts right across the street.
reviews.title: Pretty good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is a rip off- there is free on street parking north and south of the hotel where most employees park.
reviews.title: Hyatt Aventine La Jolla

likes.liked: — beautiful and spacious, very comfortable bed
likes.disliked: — having to use the room key to access our floor, on the elevator

reviews.text: We contracted with the Hyatt Regency to be our official wedding hotel, and they did a wonderful job. Many of our guests mentioned to me that the staff was welcoming, professional, and classy overall. It's really says a lot when your friends and family are making unsolicited compliments on your choice of hotel -- no kidding, we heard from many of our guests on the day they checked in. While the location (for San Diego) is a little generic in that it's in a high-density residential neighborhood not right in downtown or by the beach, it's also very convenient to everything, and the room rates are very reasonable for the quality (you could stay in downtown, but in my mind that isn't really in the spirit of San Diego, or you can stay right on the beach for a lot more money).
reviews.title: Great job as our wedding hotel

likes.liked: — Ever since our wedding, when my wife's mother comes to town, she still stays at the Hyatt. Enough said.

reviews.text: I debated many different hotels to suggest and arrange for our wedding guests (we live in San Diego, and wanted to find a good compromise between quality, convenience, and cost for our guests), and we were overall extraordinarily happy with the Hyatt.
reviews.title: Beautifull Hotel But I Left Disappointed

reviews.text: Let me start off by saying this this is a nice-lookng hotel. Good-looking rooms, restaurants and lobbies. But overall, I am a value-oriented traveller and my stay at the Hyatt La Jolla left me disappointed.
reviews.title: Lovely La Jolla Hyatt

likes.disliked: — Beds not made well by housekeeping

reviews.text: I stayed in a standard room booked through a corporate training facility that my employer uses. Rate was $225 a night for 5 nights. The problem was the fact the the room was apparently not cleaned before my arrival. The bathroom floor had stains and hair in the bathtub that wasn't cleaned until my 3rd night there. The garbage cans were also full when I got there. Not acceptable.
reviews.title: Great Regency Club lounge, access to the Sporting Club, close to Torrey Pines

reviews.text: I also got the tired of being overcharged for nearly everything. I had a can of soda from the minibar my first night there. That cost me $5. The room service pizza that I ordered set me back $26. Whenever I visited the gym, I was charged $20 per visit. Internet service was $10 or $12 per night, and if I visited the business center that would have cost me $10. Finally, I tried to get credit for my stay on my new Hyatt Gold Passport card, but was told that my rate did not merit any points. Get the picture?
reviews.title: Solid hotel...Good alternative to Downtown

reviews.text: Stayed here for a conference. The conference was actually not at this hotel- I chose to stay here instead to avoid noise and traffic of the "conference" hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Very nice hotel with a staff that pushes it to outstanding
reviews.text: I really like the Hyatt La Jolla.
They were super pleasant and professional starting at check-in.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The valets are very attentive and professional/polite. Get a package that includes parking. There is some street parking but it's a PAIN.
reviews.title: Wish we were at the Hilton

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is great but they let us substitute with a $$ amt for room service so I could order what I wanted. Including Starbucks!
reviews.title: Nice hotel for business travelers

reviews.text: I was here for a conference, and was not able to take advantage of all of the facilities.
reviews.title: Nice place, but some issues

likes.disliked: — Restaurants need a lot of improvement, especially considering the options nearby

reviews.text: Nice rooms as you would expect of a Hyatt, and wonderful housekeeping. Probably the best thing about this hotel was the very attentive and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service, Relaxing Stay

reviews.text: I was not able to use the fitness facilites, but the word from others in the group was that it was quite good in terms of equipment, staff, space, cleanliness, etc.
reviews.title: Nice rooms

reviews.text: The hotel was not that convenient to other restaurants, etc. We often took a cab to La Jolla town or Del Mar for dinner.
reviews.title: Best area of San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What needs improvement: the restaurant on the lower level is serviceable at best. Given this location in southern California, and LaJolla in particular, this is unacceptable. If you were here on vacation, you'd like to have a car to get to better dining spots and touring, or stay closer at a different hotel that was closer to more amenities.
reviews.title: Good Times in La Jolla

reviews.text: Two nights in the big city. Fast elevators. Good food. Rooms were typical Hyatt,,upscale, clean and trendy. Property is quiet. Internet kind of sucked, but hey, they probably don't have business class cisco equipment. Garage was typical of a big city environment. Secure/large and easily accessible. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice view

reviews.text: there for annual 3 day business meeting that is held around san diego area. hotel was easy to find, lots of parking, lots of friendly staff. even though i didn't have the breakfast chits they were willing to feed me no charge. we are hyatt gold pass members and they upgraded our room to an allergy free environment - ionizer, non-smoking, natural fibers, etc., overlooking the pool. food was excellent - we ate breakfast, lunch and a dinner there. didn't use sports area, but saw others - very clean and spacious. can't say enough about the very helpful and friendly staff - especially melanie, who checked us in and another melanie in the breakfast area working as maitre'd.
reviews.title: treated royally at la jolla

reviews.text: The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel. The highlight of the hotel is bar. The bartender was extremely friendly and heavy handed with the alcohol. The enitre staff of the hotel went out of their way to treat us well. Doors were opened at all of the entrances. The pool was very nice, the jacuzzi was beautifully located. The rooms we large but lacked basic amenities, like a coffee maker. For the price of the hotel and the convience store, it should have more ammenties. We had room service one night which was very delicious. We went to Flemings ( The restaurant next to the hotel) and found it very dissapointing, the wait staff was over booked and the quality of the very expensive meat was not to par. The local area was very nice. The La Jolla coves are about a 10 minute drive and Sea World was about a 15 minute drive. All in all we had a great stay here.
reviews.title: Relaxing location

reviews.text: We stayed over New Years to visit friends in La Jolla. Low AAA weekend rates include breakfast buffet - but the breakfast area in the lower section of the hotel is freezing cold!
reviews.title: Business Hotel

reviews.text: Rest is excellent, a couple good restaurants are just 50 feet from the hotel entrance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel.... Great Service..... Very Accomodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed here a few times since 2006 (most recently Jan 2008). It's a new hotel with easy access to the 5 Freeway. Although not on the beach, it's only about 10 min from the coast in non-rush-hour traffic. VERY close to UCSD, SD VA hospital. Shopping close to hotel.
reviews.title: Good for a weekend in San Diego

likes.liked: — Clean, nice rooms, good location, comfortable bedding, no smoke smell, new
likes.disliked: — Expensive parking, but free on street

reviews.text: Clean, large rooms. Very comfortable beds. Quiet. Large bathrooms. Hairdryers in room. Nice shampoo, cond, soap, etc. Thermostats in room to control temp to the degree. Large TV with cable. Looks like a couple of banquet rooms, so try to get higher up to avoid noise from weddings, etc. at night.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is expensive, but there is plenty of free street parking unlike some other Hyatts in the area. Valet available.
reviews.title: quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is nice, but expensive -- it's better to go out nearby.
reviews.title: Nice Typical Hyatt Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a fancy workout facility but there is a charge. The pool (25 meter) is free and well maintained.
reviews.title: Hyatt Regency La Jolla, terrible experience

likes.disliked: — Doorman/valet attitude and condion of rooms.

reviews.text: Just returned from 4 days at this site. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The room was standard. The food that was served for our conference was outstanding.
reviews.title: Good accommodations for business meeting

reviews.text: The only issue I had was that the location of the hotel did not lend much to do in the evening . If you wanted to go to the beaches of La Jolla or the town center you had to take a taxi. They did have four restaruants right across from the entrance that you could walk to. Took advantage of that two nights.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in La Jolla

reviews.text: Just returned from a business trip to the Hyatt Regency La Jolla. I agree completely with other reviewers - a very good hotel made excellent by the staff. I loved nearly everything about the property - clean, safe, comfortable accommodations, excellent service from all aspects of the hotel and overall a great option in La Jolla for business. The only thing I would change is the lack of dining outlets. While the 4 places across the parking lot are lovely, a place for a quick lunch (aside from the bar) would be a great addition. Also, there is no place in the hotel (again, aside from the bar) that serves dinner, leaving you with the choice of pricy specialty restaurants across the street, or bar food.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay over Easter weekend

reviews.text: Be that as it may, the HRLJ is a great hotel in a great location. Loved my stay!
reviews.title: Impressed by this beautiful hotel....highly recommend it as an option in La Jolla

reviews.text: My daughter and I had a lovely weekend at the Hyatt La Jolla Aventine. She's attending SDSU and lives in an apartment, but since I was planning a visit for Easter weekend, we decided to make it a fun girls weekend and stay someplace. We took advantage of the "free Sunday" promotion so only paid for two of three nights. We booked a room on the club level enjoy breakfast and snacks as provided.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: I stay here often, usually just a day or two at a time. Great location for business in the La Jolla area. Excellent staff and service. Nicely appointed rooms.
reviews.title: Very convenient for business in La Jolla

reviews.text: We were here for business (conference being held at the hotel.) Check in and out was easy, with efficient/polite staff handling the process flawlessly. The hotel looked shiny and new (but probably just refurbished) rooms were clean, adequate in size and housekeeping seemed to do a very thorough job every day. Parking is expensive ($25 day valet/$20 self park), as is the norm for nicer hotels in the SD area. Hotel is in a location where there are many good restaurant choices nearby--and fairly close to a shopping center/ movie theater, grocery store-a Whole Foods, etc. as well. We enjoyed our stay here and even got to meet a few of the San Francisco 49er team, as they were staying in the hotel ahead of their NFL game vs. the Chargers. We'd definitely consider staying here again when business takes us to La Jolla and the Golden Triangle.
reviews.title: Great Stay in a nice location

reviews.text: I love coming to visit La Jolla, especially when I get this hotel for a great deal on Priceline. I felt that the room was 'okay' perhaps since I booked on Priceline that maybe I got a room that had a few minor issues that I'm not going to really even mention. They do have valet ($25/day) and self parking ($20/day) but there is plenty of on street parking that is pretty safe, but I would always use common sense. I signed up to be a Hyatt Gold Passport member which I would recommend if you end up getting this room through a site like Priceline/Hotwire. Perks like late check out at 2pm. Also, the pool looked nice but didn't use it. Wish there was free wifi.
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.text: We just stayed for my daughters 9th bday. the staff was wonderful, the valet and the front desk as wonderful customer service and attention to detail. A great place if you plan to do Seaworld or Legoland etc - on the middle with a fabulous pool. The staff made this trip A+" Rooms are just ok - a bit dated and old but we did not spend time in the room. The decorations were clean and nice.
reviews.title: great Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our children gave us a 2 night stay at this beautiful hotel for our anniversary....Just had an amazing time...excellent location, beautiful hotel ..wonderful staff and the general mgr scott allen upgraded our room...Cannot ask for more...The pool area and the hot tub was great....nice cabanas to relax, really enjoyed the beautiful hotel...Amazing location...within minutes to everything..Fleming's and melting point just across and amc theatre 2 blocks...15 minute walk...and the La jolla cove and beach Few minutes...
reviews.title: Had an amazing 30th anniversary...at this hotel

description: Designed by the acclaimed architect Michael Graves, the hotel is a masterpiece of imported Italian marbles, exotic woods, custom designed furniture and ancient art, and a 32,000 square foot Sporting Club.
